alert.note: Alert for Albany; Goshen; Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 28 at 1:19PM MST until January 28 at 1:45PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... Southwestern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Western Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 145 PM MST. * At 118 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Whitaker to near Granite Springs Campground, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 20 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 20 and 44. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 345 and 353. Locations impacted include... Granite Springs Reservoir, Federal, Granite Springs Campground, Whitaker, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground and Ranchettes. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
